assessments.label: Deadlift
assessments.description: A deadlift is a resistance exercise in which you hinge your hips to lift a loaded barbell off the floor.  The 1RM deadlift assessment tests your maximum force production while lifting a loaded barbell off of the floor. This test is to be performed without equipment including belts, straps, or sleeves.

assessments.label: Squat
assessments.description: No supportive equipment (Weight lifting belt allowed). Must squat below parallel

assessments.label: Weighted Pull-up
assessments.description: No supportive equipment. Weight added below waist. No kipping. Must start in dead-hang position. Must pause in top position for 1 second. Bottom of chin must reach higher than the top of the bar.

assessments.label: Bench
assessments.description: No supportive equipment. Barbell must make contact with body in bottom position

assessments.label: Squats
assessments.description: No stopping movement at any point once the test has begun. Top of thighs must be below top of knees in bottom position. Knees must straighten in top position.

assessments.label: Pushups
assessments.description: No stopping movement at any point once the test has begun. Top of elbows must be higher than top of the shoulders in bottom position. Arms must straighten in top position.

assessments.label: Pullups
assessments.description: No stopping movement at any point once the test has begun. Arms must straighten in bottom position. Bottom of chin must reach higher than the top of the bar. No kipping.

assessments.label: Standing Long Jump
assessments.description: Feet must move in tandem. Heel that is furthest back is measured.

assessments.label: Push Press
assessments.description: No supportive equipment. No catch.

assessments.label: Clean
assessments.description: No supportive equipment (Weight lifting belt allowed)

assessments.label: 100 meter sprint
assessments.description: No starting blocks. No spikes.

assessments.label: Pike
assessments.description: Position must be held for 30 seconds

assessments.label: Backbend
assessments.description: Position must be held for 5 seconds

assessments.label: Straddle
assessments.description: Position must be held for 5 seconds

assessments.label: 2 minute distance
assessments.description: Treadmill or track allowed

assessments.label: 1 hour distance
assessments.description: Road, treadmill, or track allowed

assessments.label: Static Apnea
assessments.description: Time stops after inhale

assessments.label: Agility
assessments.description: Must touch cone with hand. Order of cones must be followed. Feet cannot cross during the left and right cones.

assessments.label: Balance
assessments.description: (see each skill for specific rules)

assessments.label: Coordination
assessments.description: (see each skill for specific rules)
